statements: UPDATE security_policies SET policy_name='Policy 1', policy_description='This is policy 1 description', access_level='Admin' WHERE id=1;
UPDATE security_policies SET access_level='User', policy_description='This is the user policy description', policy_name='User Policy' WHERE id=2;
UPDATE security_policies SET access_level = 'Restricted' WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE security_policies SET policy_description = 'Enhanced security measures' WHERE policy_name = 'Data Encryption';
UPDATE security_policies SET policy_name='New Policy 1', policy_description='Updated description 1' WHERE policy_id=1;
UPDATE access_control_lists SET acl_name='Updated ACL 2', permissions='READ, WRITE' WHERE acl_id=2;
UPDATE security_policies SET policy_description = 'New policy description' WHERE policy_id = 1;
UPDATE access_control_lists SET permissions = 'read,write' WHERE acl_id = 3;
UPDATE SecurityPolicies SET policy_description = 'Updated policy description' WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE UserRoles SET description = 'New role description', role_name = 'Admin' WHERE role_id = 1;
UPDATE SecurityPolicies SET policy_description = 'Updated policy description' WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE AccessControlLists SET permission = 'READ_WRITE', access_level = 'Admin' WHERE acl_id = 5;
UPDATE SecurityPolicies SET PolicyDescription = 'New policy description' WHERE PolicyID = 1;
UPDATE AccessControlLists SET AccessLevel = 'Admin' WHERE ACLID = 3;
UPDATE SecurityPolicies SET PolicyDescription = 'Updated policy description' WHERE PolicyID = 1;
UPDATE Users SET Username = 'updated_username', Email = 'new_email@example.com' WHERE UserID = 2;
UPDATE security_policies SET policy_description = 'Updated description' WHERE policy_id = 1;
UPDATE access_control_lists SET access_level = 'ADMIN' WHERE resource_id = 3 AND user_id = 5;
UPDATE security_policies SET policy_description = 'Updated policy description' WHERE policy_id = 1;
UPDATE access_control_lists SET access_level = 'ADMIN' WHERE acl_id = 2;
